modules.description: Blends two RGB colors by interpolating their components based on a given mix factor. Works with the `rgb` type, which represents colors using red, green, and blue components. Useful for generating smooth color transitions or combining colors in graphics applications.

Converts standard RGB color values to and from linear RGB space and transforms linear RGB values to XYZ color space. Operates on rgb, lrgb, and xyz record types representing color channels in different color spaces. Useful for color correction, rendering pipelines, and preparing colors for perceptual calculations.

This module converts XYZ color values to related color spaces. It provides functions to transform XYZ into linear RGB, CIE 1960 UV, and both standard and reference-based CIE Luv color representations. These operations are essential for color space conversions in image processing and color science applications.

Defines a standard D65 white reference point in the XYZ color space. Provides direct access to the D65 illuminant values used in color conversion and calibration tasks. Useful for applications requiring precise color management, such as image processing or display calibration.

Converts ANSI color codes to RGB values. Works with `Colors.ansi` and `Colors.rgb` types. Useful for rendering terminal colors in graphical interfaces or converting terminal output to web-compatible formats.

Converts LUV color values to XYZ coordinates using either a specified reference white or a default, and blends two LUV colors using a given mix ratio. Operates on the `Colors.luv` and `Colors.xyz` types. Useful for color space transformations and smooth color interpolation in graphics applications.

Handles color space conversions and transformations between ANSI, RGB, XYZ, LUV, and UV color models. Provides functions to blend colors, convert terminal ANSI codes to RGB, linearize RGB values, and perform precise color interpolation using standard D65 white reference. Useful for rendering terminal colors in GUIs, color correction pipelines, and image processing workflows requiring accurate color representation.
